website_summaries.verdict: Great color and responsiveness at an affordable price. A good choice for those who like a satisfying click with every keystroke.
pros: Excellent lighting that can be adjusted to your preference
Can easily be seen even next to a bright monitor
RGB lighting offers different colors and settings
cons: A few users had issues with sticky keys

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a K552-RGB keyboard on 6/30/2018. I received ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a K552-RGB keyboard on 6/30/2018. I received it on 07/02/2018. Within 14 days, I noticed that the "z" key was not functioning. I notified ChallengerUSA by email on 07/15/2018. On 07/16/2018, they requested my order #, which I provided on 07/16/2018. On 07/17/2018, I received a notice that a prepaid label would be provided the next day. Three days later and I have heard nothing since.
customer_reviews.author: callen g.

customer_reviews.title: BEST RGB KEYBOARD YOU CAN GET FOR THE PRICE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: All i can say is this is the best keyboard you can get for the price , it has RGB and the blue switches feel just like the mx cherry blues. dont bother spending your money on other keyboards when you can get this for 40 bucks. It has alot of animations you can choose from. Check out the video i attached.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ospina

customer_reviews.title: 3000 Decibels of fun.
customer_reviews.text: Really great keyboard except for one major setback. IT IS LOUD! Loud like standing beside Niagra falls while AC/DC plays "Back in Black" from a Blackhawk Helicopter. Loud like Donald Trump reading from Mien Kampf during a Black lives matter rally. If you ever wondered how the universe was created, it was because someone touched this freaking keyboard and the sound started a massive explosion which lead to the universe to constantley expand. Literally, this is the big bang. Response time is great, the build quality is great, the lighting is really cool, but they may think about making this thing wireless as I want to strangle the person using it with the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I cannot stress enough the value presented here...
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought Logitech and Corsair stuff, but I decided to try and be more budget-conscious, so I decided to give Redragon a chance... I cannot express how glad I am that I did. I bought this keyboard, the Zeus 7.1 Ch headset, and the Cobra mouse, and a extra large mousepad all for close to the price of just a Logitech or Corsair keyboard ALONE. The quality of these Redragon accessories leaves nothing at all to be desired. They look and feel just as high quality as all the bigger name brands. I am extremely happy with Redragon and needless to say, they've gained a fan!
customer_reviews.author: SGM

customer_reviews.title: 7, 8 and 9
customer_reviews.text: What in the sam he... where's 7, 8 and 9?!? This thing is usesless to me without them. Bummed because it feels like a winner. I'm not even gonna plug it in tho. Back it goes. Call me when you add 7, 8 and 9. #789
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Solid, compact, back lit keybord delivers perfect gaming performance at a value price!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a much more expensive gaming keyboard with this product, and it has worked perfectly so far! It can be brightly back lit in a number of different colors, has a great feel (once I got used to its mechanical key switches), and a simple interface that requires no additional software driver to implement all its extended functions (back light controls, OS media playback controls, etc.). I like it's small size without the unnecessary numeric key pad, but do wish I could turn off the somewhat distracting, periodic "breathing" of the back lighting that it does - to just have the back lights on for a constant and steady appearance. Recommended as a good value that works great!
customer_reviews.author: David p.

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, iffy usb cord
customer_reviews.text: Its a solid keyboard with uniform lighting. So far the switches work great. The puller isn't that great, it has a tendency to gouge the keys when fitting over the base. Impressive construction for the price. This is my second board from Red Dragon and my K502 Karura is still 100% after years. The only issue I have had is after a few months the usb plug housing is going out. I'm going to have to splice a new end on it which sucks. It came wonky but i didn't think too much about it. Not sure if it is just one that slipped past QA or what. No other reviewers mention this so I guess I just got unlucky.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Keyboard but Keys Stick
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yr old son purchased this keyboard as his first gaming keyboard. He read the reviews and really thought about what he wanted for the price. He seems happy but every once in awhile I hear hollering from his room. When I ask what is going on he complains that the keys stick. We bought compressed air and he cleans them. This seems to do the job. -Oh, you should know, the keyboard is loud. I can hear that clicking with his door shut. I guess that is a good thing with gaming keyboards..IDK
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Meyn

customer_reviews.title: Key switches on the K552 RGB - 87 key are removable without desoldering.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, everything is amazing for the price. Heavy metal reinforcement plate. Decent switches that are RGB compatible. Some of the LEDs are not color correct though, Like one blue is slight different than another blue on a solid color setting. I wish it had better lighting customization, even though the software on their site is pretty good, there could be more options. Perhaps one day someone could software mod it to enable full lighting customization. Best board for the price. No doubt. Something I was to clarify is that with the K552 RGB 87 the switches are removable without soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: My review of this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard for gaming.Though it has the spring sound its a great keyboard. This keyboard used blue mx cherry switches which are very loud but tacile keys makes some people wanna type it more.The rgb light are awesome with bright settings with a lot of lighting effects on it.If you are looking for a keyboard that is cheap mechanical very loud decent for gaming and durable then I would recommend this keyboard. Pros Very cheap for a mechanical keyboard Very nice rgb lighting crisp tacile keys Pretty good for gaming Durable keys Cons Kinda loud for office A little uncomforable for a long run It might contain milk :)
customer_reviews.author: Trang N.

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is great for gaming and exactly what my son wanted. The lights, brightness and features are fun and colorful. It gives him alot of variety to change the look up whenever he wants something different. The tool to remove the keys is nice and helps for when he wants to do exactly that. The click sounds are loud but nothing out of the ordinary for a gaming keyboard. It's in the family of standard keyboards so it's not what you would call an ergonomic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Hard to please gamer son impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard for my hard to please gamer son for Christmas. When he first opened it up he wasn't too impressed and complained it was not his style. However, I asked him to try it before we consider other options and he immediately realized this was an awesome keyboard. He loved the lights, but more importantly, he was uber impressed with how this keyboard improved his gaming experience. He especially liked the programmable keys. I sent him a text to ask him to rate it from 1 to 5 stars and he immediately texted back "5". Thanks for making me look good.
customer_reviews.author: Billywashere

customer_reviews.title: Good for its price
customer_reviews.text: Its a good entry mech keyboard. It has blue switches, which may be annoying, but its switch, not membrane. Its ten key less, so it takes up less space. There are tons of lighting effects. However, there seem to be different batches getting sent out. One batch is the newer version I guess? The newer version is hot swappable, while the other isn't. Unfortunately, I didn't get the new version. So mines wasn't hot swappable. Its just weird, seeing how others got hot swappable boards while others don't. Overall, its a great keyboard for its price, and a great keyboard for people who just want a cheap keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Hoangvo

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great choice for the price
customer_reviews.text: High quality, fair price. Awesome tactile feel. But be warned, it's loud af. If you live by yourself or you're listening to music or something when you're using it it's awesome. But if you're just trying to chill and there's another person within earshot, you might drive them crazy. Luckily, the switches can be changed out for something quieter if it's a huge problem. It's a little tall, so I ended up buying a wrist-wrest for when I use it and the height hasn't bothered me since then.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Standel

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: First keyboard i ever bought that didn't come with the computer. The lights are mesmerizing and beautiful. The feel is top notch and its heavy. Very well made with distinctive clicks when u press the keys. Not a keyboard if you want quiet or average typing sound. But for typical use its not annoying butnit sute if id wanna type an essay with it but maybe since using it just pressing the keys is fun with its look n feel n different auditory experience.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this keyboard so much. The feel and click of cherry mx blue switches makes typing a great experience. I didn't use it for gaming, but the keys are responsive and quick. I could easily see this as a keyboard you mash buttons on. I liked the click because you don't have to bottom out on each key and can "float" on top of the keys a bit more. My typing speed went up considerably with this keyboard. An absolute joy to use even without mentioning the gorgeous color display options!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was just going to get the red version, but thought, why not just spend 10 more bucks and get the RGB? It feels great, a good mechanical keyboard, and also you can customize the colors into whatever you want. I like coming home from work and looking at it, it looks cool. The colors are bright, except for maybe dark blue. My little brother bought his for 160 bucks or so, he shoulda just spent 45 bucks and got this instead. The CON is that it doesn't come with a 10-key num pad on the right hand side.
customer_reviews.author: surosh

customer_reviews.title: Help!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboar for 4 months now. Its been like 3 weeks that i starte to notice that some of the keys arent working sometimes an it gets really annoying. The keys that arent really working are " T and D". I want to know if warranty will help with this kin of issue. as you can notice there are a lot of spelling errors which r missing the "T" an "D"
customer_reviews.author: Andy Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the switches and now it's perfect
customer_reviews.text: I liked the blue switches, but I got tired of how loud they were. Many people love the blues so this would be a great keyboard for those people. The switches are hot-swappable so I replaced them with Cherry MX brown RGB switches and I love them. Just keep in mind that you'll have to get a mini diamond file and file down the pins on the new switches since the original blue switch pins are smaller than a standard pin.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed this keyboard to go with a new pc built and wanted to cut costs at least initially on perepherials. I’m pleasantky surprised so far and haven’t bothered replacing it. I bought a matching red dragon 5 button mouse with the keyboard and have been happy with the pair. The rgb keys are cool and have a lot preset options. If they’re individually programmable I haven’t bothered to figure that out yet. Only wish I had bought a full keyboard with a number pad but that’s on me. Now that I own a mechanical keyboard I may go with Something a bit quieter next time but this exceeds my expectation for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable mechanical keyboard to pair with my logittech G502 gaming mouse and stumbled upon this beauty. This mechanical keyboard provides excellent value for its price point. The keys feel well built and provide great tactile feedback and travel. The wide range of RGB color modes and settings are also a great addition, especially at this price point. Perhaps my only gripe with this keyboard is that it uses a bit too much plastic, but thats to be expected at this price point and in no way hinders its performance. Overall, I am thoroughly enjoying this keyboard and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to get a great mechanical keyboard at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gaming Keyboard for the Price
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I tried this keyboard, I was going to give 1 start because some of the keys would make a metal spring sound whenever I press them, but I'm glad that I gave it a try for 2 months now; the annoying and cheap sounds are all gone so I am currently very satisfied with the product. The only downside is that this keyboard is very high so after a few hours of gaming at night, I feel fatigue on my back of my hand. Other than this, this is a great product, has a variety of LED combo, makes loud noises, is heavy, and is inexpensive. Very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: For the price, You get an above average product.
customer_reviews.text: Red Dragon never disappoints with their Keyboards. Mice & Headsets are a different story though, but I've been buying Kurama Keyboards from them since 2014, this is my 4th one, ( Two owned currently one for lappy when on dock, and one for gaming desktop, other two i smashed up from CSGO :') ). Their build quality is surprisingly sturdy and takes a literal beating before keys stop working. Had two Red only backlight ones that worked amazing, Got this one because i've been loving the RGB atheistic a lot lately, and I fell in love, so i got that other one for my room!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: I cannot find a better keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: To reduce the clacking of the keys, I added 1.5mm thick sound damping o-rings on each of the keys. This is much easier if you get a key puller that uses two wire "loops" to pull the key caps. The keys now feel and sound nice and clicky. The price of this keyboard cannot be beat, and the fully-RGB version is only about $10 more than the red-backlit version. The only think I would change at this point is to have a USB instead of an attached USB cable so I could use a nicer, braided USB cable to connect the keyboard to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: John Bindel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: •Rigid/sturdy •Cheap •Great build quality •Nice tactile switch feel •Responsive and reliable •High bezel •Beautiful design •Great board for customizing •easy to clean Cons: •The lights aren't as bright as you'd like, but what you'd expect for a keyboard in this price range •Loud, not really a con. All blue switches are loud, if you dont like blue switches dont buy them Overall: For the price unbeatable. The kumara blue switches feel and sound great. The high bezel gives a very modern look which i love, and pairs wonderuly sith a thick wrist rest like the grafiti one for about 12-15 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Best Mechanical Gaming Keyboard for price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second best keyboard I've ever used. Razer's Chroma keyboards only barely beating it but for a fraction of the price it's a no brainer. The lighting modes are the most varied of any other keyboard and the mechanical keys are very clicky and good in general. I'll be buying this keyboard in the future if I ever need another one. The only minor issue I have with it is that it's THICC. It's quite heavy for a tenkeyless but I'm guessing it has to do with the build quality and strength of the materials used so it's an acceptable trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Balance
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely weighted and balanced keyboard, especially since it is a compact 87tkl keyboard. The keys are fast and responsive, and the lights are nice and bright without being a distraction. The keys are truly "blue key" and clicky. I bought this for work, so I will need to exchange it for a less "clicky" red key keyboard. I will replace this one with the Red Dragon K552 that has the red keys.
customer_reviews.author: QuietLady

customer_reviews.title: Quality, but noisy. Check that switch type before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: The full sized version of this board uses Brown switches, which are considerably less noisy than the clattering Blue switches in this model. I did not notice that change when I decided to purchase the cut down model. Still, this is a high quality board. Heavy, good key placement, nice feedback. The color mapping is kind of screwy at first - like setting up an old digital watch or something - but it’s easy to do once you figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzysoul

customer_reviews.title: Very excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for the purpose of gaming. I wish I had done more research however, because the blue switches are very loud and I should have gotten the red switches. They blues are very comfortable for typing and in fact I am using the keyboard right now to write this review! If you live in close quarters with anyone else, this keyboard could get a bit annoying. Otherwise, this is great. The RGB is nice and bright and is not a priority of mine personally, but I do like how it looks. This is a great first mechanical keyboard to buy and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A gamer

customer_reviews.title: Best Mechanical Keys for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Das Keyboard and Ducky for years and after purchasing 2 of these for my kids, I feel like getting one for myself. I was surprised to find NO play in the keys and was able to type with ease. The kids like the clicky sound and the RGB is awesome! Easy to configure and very bright but not overwhelming. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly nice!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I was very hesitant when I ordered this key border. It was under $50, with RGB and Good mechanical switches. I got it so while my $200 keyboard is being fixed I could still type and play games. It is amazingly well built, the switches make all the correct sounds and feel great. So far I am digging this little keyboard! The lack of a 10 pad is throwing me off a little, but it nothing I will not adjust to quickly. So for now, I would recommend picking this one up!
customer_reviews.author: adam hunter

customer_reviews.title: You can't complain much for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Keyboard looks gorgeous. You can change the RGB colors and has a pretty good array of settings to choose from. The only complain is when you are typing fast, you can hear the ringing of the spring underneath the keys. But again for the price, you should be pretty happy. I love typing on this keyboard. I would recommend anyone who is out looking for a starter mechanical keyboard to give it a try, see if you like it.
customer_reviews.author: Biplab

customer_reviews.title: Better than OEM but not a serious gamer upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The lighting is purely aesthetic with no customization for gaming. In my opinion, the keys are more like Cherry MX red than the claimed blue equivalent. It's weighted well but a bit cheap in construction. The space bar doesn't have a good feel. It moves around too much. The number pad only has 1-6 for some reason. This may be an upgrade on your OEM keyboard but not a huge one.
customer_reviews.author: SilverRider

customer_reviews.title: Great for budget gaming, without skimping on quality
customer_reviews.text: Great mechanical keyboard! Key presses are quite tactile & clicky/ audible. Never have owned a mechanical keyboard till now, but i now know what I've been missing out on. The rgb lighting is nice for the price, just to be able to have a few options for lighting/ effects/ color, without paying a ton more for individual/ per key lighting. Keyboard is SOLID.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Cox

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy overpriced keyboards!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy overpriced keyboards! Just buy this and you are done. Feels pretty "clicky", it does not feels cheap at all. Pretty impresive for the price. The RGB are bright and nice.
customer_reviews.author: Didhier

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Pros: solid construction (plastic over metal), LED patterns configurable from the keyboard, angle risers, does not slip or move. Cons: a noticeable metal-on-metal twang when keys are pressed (in addition to the desired CLICK!), high current draw may cause undervolting when used with SBCs like the Raspberry Pi. Overall: excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Exscotticus

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Clickety Clack
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a great value... probably just as nice as keyboards that cost 2-3 times as much. Very sturdy and doesn't flex. I'm no keyboard connoisseur but this keyboard has a great tactile feel (due to the MX blue switches) and that awesome "clickety-clack" sound (again due to the MX blue switches) that is reminiscent of the old IBM model M keyboards of old.
customer_reviews.author: DelcoShopper

customer_reviews.title: I purchase two of these and 1 with a numeric keypad
customer_reviews.text: Despite having to have the keyboard replaced under warranty, I have two of this model and one of the same manufacturer that has a numeric key pad. They replaced my three original IBM pre USB/PS2 tactile mechanical keyboards that stopped working using IBM PC to PS2 to USB adapters. Two of the keyboards are used on windows PC's, and the third is used on an Android tablet with a Micro USB to USB adapter. I would have given them aaa5 stars if I hadn'at had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: dedicate user

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, a good price, and very well made. Good options to select from for the color of the keyboard and easy to select as well. I would definitely purchase this keyboard again. P.S. Don't be like me and buy the keyboard with the number pad on the right hand side. Definitely would have been worth the extra money as my work computer is made just like that.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend. This keyboard sounds so awesome when typing, has all the functions of ambient lighting and the pictures represent the product very well. It is a medium keyboard in terms of total desk space you may have, there are ones at this price point that could be even more ergonomic and there are keyboards with more functions or a number pad etc. but this is a perfect middle ground and I am extremely satisfied with my use of this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: BootyNuggets.

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is complete trash
customer_reviews.text: The mechanical key press is tinny and there is no way to set just a single backlight color, which is ridiculous. The website mentioned in the 1-page instructions if, of course, invalid. Going to the US website and pressing downloads to perhaps get an app to set features just takes you to the FAQ page and is useless. Typical Chinese garbage. Returned within minutes of setup.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Precise! But clicky
customer_reviews.text: This is the most accurate click keybaord you will ever use. Each click is precise and 100% accurate. But if you stream. This thing is clickier than a garage remote, noise wise. Bad only for those who stream because your mic will be thinking you got hail outside. But if you game alone in your parents basement with a headset on, boy oh boy get this!
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the keys would not function correctly and you have to press it hard or multiple times for it to work. I recommend another keyboard or look elsewhere. Will try to request a refund. EDIT: I reached out to the Challenger USA, and they happily replaced the keyboard in exchanged for a new one. I also requested that they send me the replacement before i send the defective keyboard since i need it for personal use and don't have an extra keyboard on me. Best customer service, and will recommend their products!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great Keyboard. It seems to be more of a cherry MX blue equivalent. It is much louder than my coolermaster cherry MX blues. It also clicks down slightly easier and requires slightly less force than the blues. For the price this is a great keyboard, although based on the specs I thought I was getting a green switch. The keyboard works perfectly on a Mac, just make sure to switch the modifier keys under system preferences. (you can then even pull the keys out and switch them physically.) My only gripe is there is no alt key on the right side.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: A great first step into mechanical keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: After using membrane keyboards for years, it felt so nice to get my hands on a mechanical. My typing speed went up very quickly and I wondered why this was. I came to find it was because on a membrane keyboard I never knew if I actually fully pressed a key, but with a mechanical keyboard there's an audible and tactile click. (I heard the word tactile a lot in videos talking about mechanicals and didn't know what it meant. it just keep means you can feel when the key is pressed like when you press the power button on your computer)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Its my fault for not noticing that this keyboard does not have the number buttons on the right side. Otherwise though, the keys are super ergonomic, and make those satisfying mechanical keyboard noises. The backlight color on it is cool, and there are like 18 different settings for them. Not programmable as far as I can tell, but it works just fine for me
customer_reviews.author: Thisguy

customer_reviews.title: Its just alright.
customer_reviews.text: I am no a person that cares about look but functionality. Had this keyboard for a few months. Keys stick sometimes, doesn't bother me too much. Usually one press will fix it. Seems like there's a very slight delay, but for $40, you get what you pay for. If you're looking to be very competitive in gaming, id look somewhere else. But if you're just a casual, probably the one I'd get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this keyboard, but be prepared for the noise
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this keyboard. I highly recommend this to anyone looking to get a mechanical keyboard but don't want to spend hundreds of dollars. Pros: The Outemu Blue switches feel almost identical to their Cherry MX Blue counterparts. The clicky switches are a dream to type on. Feels and sounds FANTASTIC! A real mechanical keyboard, not aknockoff that sounds kind of like it. Great price. RGB lighting looks great. Tons of custimization options. Cons: A little louder than normal Cherry MX Blues (which are already quite loud). My roommate had Outemu Blue switches and I wasn't able to sleep. These are LOUD. Space bar is pretty heavy. Did I mention they're loud? tl;dr Great keyboard, but bad for roommates.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for first mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The clicks in this keyboard GREAT LOVE THEM but if you are looking for a satisfying Mechanical bump this keyboard doesn’t have that but it is also some what smooth it does have a bit of resistance with the key switches but if this is your first mechanical keyboard this is a great start the keys do have a springy like sound when you push them but it’s no big deal and the brightness is similar to a Razer keyboard but it’s at max brightness the lighting options are great only down side was the TKL board but it’s different for everyone so I recommend yes I very much do for a first mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Corina Raya

customer_reviews.title: It has nice bright RGB options and colors and a very solid ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical and hesitant before purchasing this keyboard to begin with so I kept my expectations low for a mechanical switch keyboard at this price. It has nice bright RGB options and colors and a very solid click with these switches. The reason I give it 3 stars is that the enter key started sticking. The more I used it the more it stuck; I did not eat or spill anything on it and I even removed the caps, but it seems as one of the switches failed. Over all a good product; but be wary of keys wearing out prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great RGB Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 87 key RGB mechanical keyboard. I'd like to see two improvements. One, would like to have some brighter backlighting. Second, better markings or separate backligting for the secondary function keys. The sound controls are on these secondary function keys... Would be nice if there were dedicated sound keys.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ostrom

customer_reviews.title: Really high quality keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great product. For the price I didn’t think I’ll receive much to be honest. Once the keyboard Came it had a very crisp clean click. It does have a springy sound after clicking a key but wow this keyboard is worth every penny. Typing is really fun on this keyboard just the clicking motivates you to keep typing.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Spacebar has high-pitched click which differs from other keys - no problem, but so strange.
customer_reviews.text: Spacebar has high-pitched click which differs from other keys - no problem, but so strange. Otherwise unit works well. Weight keeps it from squirming on the desk. Keys feel good. Nice and compact. Arrived promptly and works out-of-the-box without need of adjustments. I like the rainbow key lights so I didn't bother to adjust them. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome mechanical keyboard without spending a million bucks for it. This particular model only has the basic keys, so no extra number pad or other gimmick buttons. For what I wanted, it is perfect. The keys are responsive and clean, with a nice click but not overly loud. The feel is really great. There are a ton of lighting settings and colors, and the functionality is very easy to use. Overall, if you want a fantastic basic mechanical keyboard that doesn't cost you your soul, buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: The clickety sound is just right, very definite and nostalgic without the heavy key pressure required by the IBM keyboards of yore. RGB color schemes are fun, and there is a good set to play with. I don't like the "gamer" typeface on the keys, at all, as the style is hard to read with a quick glance compared to a conventional keyboard. Would be even better if it had a USB hub on the back (with USB 2 and USB 3 ports), but I suspect that is not possible at this price point, and the keyboard's power requirements are already near capacity for USB 2? Five Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Flier

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, a little loud and too compact.
customer_reviews.text: Since it has blue switches, it’s VERY loud. Some people like it, but I upgraded to brown switches for the less obnoxious clacking. I also prefer to have a num pad, which this does not. The keyboard is so compact the keys are a little too close for comfort. The RGB settings were way above my expectations. If you’re looking for an inexpensive but high quality keyboard, Redragon is the way to go. I might suggest going with the $50 option, as it has better quality switches and includes a num pad while sticking to the bang-for-your-buck concept.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gaming
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this keyboard. The rgb is really neat! We knew it was loud (clicky) because we have the red one as well, but for buyers who are unaware the click sound of the keys are very loud and can get annoying. We have 3 red dragon keyboards and have been very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Ilove2giggle95

customer_reviews.title: Still the best RGB Mechanical Keyboard you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is now my 2nd KUMARA keyboard. One at home & one at work. Paired with some O Rings to dampen the noise, this is hands down the best RBG Mechanical Keyboard you can buy at this price point. - It was plenty of illumination options. - Full RGB color control including brightness & speed of animations. - It's small form factor makes it great in tight spaces. As long as the quality doesn't go down, I will continue to buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prefer this over my Ducky Shine
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up since it was so cheap, never intending for it to be my primary keyboard. The build quality is fantastic, the lighting is well done and best of all, it is built like a tank. The one knock I have is it doesn't let you do individual light customizations, such as making the WASD keys light up in red and others in white, etc. Anyways, I liked it so much that I didn't bother swapping it out. No other keyboard comes close for $40.
customer_reviews.author: Wally Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great customization options!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is awesome I am a software developer so this mechanical keyboard helps so much ! The only concern I have is that it was slightly damaged when I received it.. I figured it was from shipment. One of the keys is scratched and the paint is messed up. Other than that the color options are amazing and a lot of my co workers are jealous!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Booth

customer_reviews.title: Overall amazing keyboard(Why)
customer_reviews.text: So I got this keyboard in RGB and so far its amazing! This is my first Ever mechanical keyboard and I'd say I got a good first impression. We ordered the back-lit red edition and the ZXCV keys stopped working in under an hour. But we got A full refund for it in under a day, Amazon return policy is great! Don't be doubting the quality of this keyboard because of price, it feels great and Will feel just right for anyone who likes clicky keyboards. The cherry MX equivalent switches are very nice. After typing a bit I started to believe the 50 million click test.
customer_reviews.author: Darya Chumakova

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard for the price tag! Really impressive.
customer_reviews.text: Great seller and great product. I did not expect the keyboard to be that good! Amazing at the price range! Well done. Colors are breathtaking and the color modes turn heads! Everyone who has seen this keyboard was impressed and did not believe the economic price tag. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ismael Al-Omari

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard. I am a touch typist and I'm very picky about keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: One of the nicest keyboards I have ever typed on. I have other much more expensive keyboards that also have cherry keys and this one is as good as those and only about 1/5th the price and you get RGB lighting to amuse yourself with for good measure. I have owned the DAS Keyboard with blue switches and I still own a WASD keyboard with red switches. Both of those keyboards are much more expensive than this one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good option for the price!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best mechanical options quality-price relation, maybe it is a little small and is hard to get used at the start while you practice it without mention hoe tricky is change the colors/animation until you see the comments column haha I am very satisfied with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Goyeneche

customer_reviews.title: this thing is great. The mechanical action is crisp and satisfying
customer_reviews.text: Honestly for the price, this thing is great. The mechanical action is crisp and satisfying, the lights are pleasing, and it's very responsive. My only complaint is that when I ordered it I didn't realize that it had no number pad. Of course, that's not the product's fault, as it is, according to design, working flawlessly. For my next buy, I'll probably get one exactly like it, except with the numberpad included.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Just BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing keyboard! I bought this for my bf having no knowledge of computer accessories. But I'm SO glad I found redragon. He is obsessed with it. He does a lot of photoshop projects and he said it's nice to know where and where and what your pressing without having to look for the letter. You can set the lights custom to your use. Also. There are SO many more features than what they have on their ad. It's been really fun. I can't believe I'm saying that about a keyboard, but I am!
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good keyboard but don't want to pay a high price? Then I highly recommend this keyboard! I use this keyboard on my PC and my Xbox and it works flawlessly. If you order the RGB Variant such as I did you get many options to choose from from wave effect to reacting to key presses! I have had no issues at all and it is very comfortable to use while gaming! Note: This keyboard comes with Blue Switches installed and a Tool to take the keys out if needed
customer_reviews.author: Salvador

customer_reviews.title: It's an amazing keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best keyboards I've used. I love the clicks sounds that a mechanical keyboard makes but it's annoying for people around, so keep that in mind. I love the back light, the click, the responsive keys and everything about this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ishan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard for the price!! However...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this keyboard. This an my G403 go very well together. Unfortunately, the D key after a months use only works half the time now and I'm very sad about this. I took of the cap tilted it and blew into it and it fixed
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing light effects and satisfying clickiness
customer_reviews.text: The light features on this keyboard are amazing I just realized that all of the buttons can control the lights on insert, home, page up, delete and page down. the instructions only say page up and page down along with the arrow keys. there are so many features on this keyboard it’s ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: NickM

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Wanted to try a smaller keyboard for fps games. Personally it's much more comfortable and your arms are at a more natural placement. I'm coming from a Corsair strafe, which I really like. This keyboard has a similar build quality in terms of materials, key switches look like the brand name ones, nice and loud and responsive on all keys. Rgb can be controlled with key combos. For the price and quality, idk if I'd go back to the big name brands after this.
customer_reviews.author: Kvn

customer_reviews.title: TOUGH
customer_reviews.text: Aside from all the other nice things you've red about this... this keyboard is TOUGH! I slammed both fists down on this keyboard in a fit of rage and it was 100% ok. I COULD NOT BELIEVE IT . I had to come and write a review just because of that, A+ product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dombrowski

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, Mechanical & Easy to Set up! Mechanical - but no Num Pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a great intro to Mechanical keyboard. I'm very happy with the quality. I do find the keys to be a little tight together compared to my standard keyboard, but I'm getting used to them. I was sad that the keyboard did not have a num pad, as I use it for my work quite a bit. However, that aside, the colors are beautiful, and it adds fun to my daily routine. I will see how the durability holds up, but overall very happy with this purchase. It is very comfortable for my wrists, and I like that I can flip it as needed, based on my sitting location.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Great value!  Very cool keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Really cool. I bought this because I'm losing my night vision as I get older. I need backlit keys. As a bonus, the letters are large and the typeface they chose was a bold that's really nice. The sheer number of back-lighting options makes this a value added item. I was surprised by how heavy and substantial it was. The mechanical keys are very cool. The compact overall size is nice as well. No extra fluff. Best buy doesn't have anything close to this for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is AMAZING. There are 36 custom lighting options that can ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is AMAZING. There are 36 custom lighting options that can be flipped through using the (FN+INS,HOME,PGUP, etc) keys. You can control the brightness of the LED's and the speed at which they change color. The keyboard is weighted and really feels solid. The keys are similar to Cherry MX Blues and are extremely clicky for that enthusiast who really loves clickity clacking along. The fact that this keyboard is under $100 is truly astounding when every other mechanical keyboard out there goes for over or near $100. Shame on you Corsair. Either way get this keyboard and try it out! You will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Colorful
customer_reviews.text: Great, colorful keyboard that has satisfying clicky blue-keys in my case. You don't need any sort of drivers to change the many patterns and colors, so you don't have to worry about compatibility which is nice. It is small enough that I am able to fit it and myunder theI ordered along with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke King

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but...
customer_reviews.text: Lights are nice and bright, plugs into computer via USB, and comes with a tool to remove keys. However, one almost vertical row of keys were dimmer than the others. You can see in the picture, that the light isn't burned out, just dim. Not really a dealbreaker for me, because I'm still happy with it, just beware that some backlights may be faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Roger

customer_reviews.title: Really loud
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is really loud. Like, comically loud. But its my first mechanical keyboard so i cant blame the company for my ignorance. I almost kept it since it had nice quality, was inexpensive, and the RGB looked fantastic. But unfortunately, i ended up returning it (too loud) and got a different brand that has Cherry MX Silent Reds. Lesson learned. Still 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Seebs

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard reminds me a bit of a datamancer actually. Not in the design, obviously, but that the key are nice and loud and firm when you press. I use it now only for working in the office, but I like it and the noise that it makes. Its easy it put in and I like the bright colors. It is just as good as my razor, and far far better then my microsoft keyboard. It has a nice tilt to key ratio for efficient quick typing, and the keys are in a easy to read font for those of us out there who are dyslexic. I would definitely by this again. Very good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Girlwithavendetta

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Cheap = Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard at first. I wanted a smaller keyboard because I don't have a lot of desktop space. Do not expect amazingly fast response times. It's a cheap Chinese keyboard guys. It was working pretty good but all the sudden the space bar which I use to jump, stopped working most of the time. Do not expect durability at a price like this. It works but it will not last very long unless you rarely use it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome budget mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel, it’s definitely louder than some other mechanical keyboards but I personally don’t mind it. It works great, has quite a few rgb options to go through that are pretty neat. Build quality also feels awesome. Pretty hefty, solid feel for sure. 100% worth the buy, will update if anything happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob

customer_reviews.title: This is a great keyboard, button travel is a little too far though.
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly a fabulous keyboard and has served me well for everything. I love how many different colors and modes there are, and the key noise is fantastic. The ONLY reason I rated it 4 stars is because the key travel is crazy far, which is a little irritating when I want to type a long phrase or something for an essay because of how many letters it is. If they keys had less travel distance, I would be able to type much faster. All in all, amazing keyboard especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Franklin

customer_reviews.title: First time owning mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I must say am really blessed to own this keyboard got used to it in just two days. pros : looks cool fun to type with good length cable cord Cons: maybe alittle more loud than expected when typing ( but again first time using mechanical keyboard) alittle more compact and small in width no bottom tray overall , a great purchase and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Al-khalaf

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard! but it rings.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cheaper mechanical keyboard. It feels well made (I came from a razer black widow and this is comparable in feel). I would rather have this keyboard than the black widow. Caviat. only reason for 4 stars. The keyboard rings when I type. At first this REALLY bothered me. I considered returning because of this, but I got used to it and I listen to music/games most of the time while using it. I would recommend this keyboard (as long as you won't be driven mad by the slight ringing)
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: This is the best budget keyboard your going to get for less than 50$  "45$ <---- price tag."
customer_reviews.text: They have cheaper ones on the market, but they are not as good. They also have better ones on the market, but I'm reviewing this as a budget keyboard for less than 50$. If your one of those people who like nice tech, but are on a budget then this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: Loves this keyboard. May not have all the bells and whistles but it’s cheap and sturdy. Lighting is decent on it if you care about that sort of thing, but you’re probably not gonna buy a keyboard at this price point for the features.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard Is a steal!
customer_reviews.text: I can't explain how nice this thing is. Really, it's one of the best electronic products I have ever bought. I find myself doing this review, and in a sense, just enjoying the typing and colors in an almost ASMR type of experience. Buy ithe RGB! I'd almost guarantee you won't be anything but pleased.
customer_reviews.author: TravAbb

customer_reviews.title: Nice rgb keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I don't personally game but my brother uses it for gaming and likes it. I really like its quality and the footpega on the back are great. I'm very happy with it. There are so many rgb settings too. Though I only use 1 or 2 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn H.

customer_reviews.title: Loud keys
customer_reviews.text: The keys are loud enough to hear even with the door closed. Not great when my kid is live streaming Fortnite after my bedtime. Otherwise, this is a gorgeous keyboard, very responsive. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Myers Mccullough

customer_reviews.title: Most important keys stopped working. “A” and “S”
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for less than a year. The “A” and “S” keys now work 50% of the time. I will stick to Logitech or Microsoft. Their keyboards have never died on me. I’m pretty disappointed and frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy A.

customer_reviews.title: My first RGB keyboard that I'll enjoy
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this guy so I can have a better experience playing games and also creating music. Unfortunately, with the first keyboard that was sent; 4 lights weren't working. But thankfully, I was able to have Amazon ship me a new one and perfectly; this one works well. Only downside from switching from my laptop keyboard to this one is the matter of not have a numeric pad to the right side of the board. But, that is of personal preference. And regardless, does not change how much I enjoy this keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great budget keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a full sized keyboard but it was just too large on my desk. I wanted something more compact and this fits the bill well! The keys themselves are a little loud but I like the sound. If you have roommates or sleep with a significant other, the clicks might take a little while to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: could be brighter and easier to control the light modes however its gonna be hard to beat this gaming keyboard for the money, This is now my third one and use them on all my builds if im looking for something cheap with good benefits.
customer_reviews.author: marlon cibrian

customer_reviews.title: Keys broke in 2 days/2nd one came broken too POOR QUALITY ITEM
customer_reviews.text: Got this on the 16th, E and D key stopped working/clickingbouncing back up in 2 days. I played a game with this for few hours. Now I need to return it. I'll be breaking this off the floor, and eating the loss. Stay away from this product. update. So I figured, maybe the first KB came and it's was a defect, so I was stupid enough to get ANOTHER one, and well.... the D key was poped off day one, and won't go back on. I can't stress this enough. Don't even waste your cash on these, they're TERRIBLE. Poorly made item. the money I spent buying 2 of these I could have just got ONE GOOD one.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year now, and it's been great ever since I brought it. Obviously you're not gonna get all the best features on a $50 keyboard, but it does it's job at a low price. I love the feel of it and the keys always look great. the font is pretty cool as well. It's small but not too small as it has the 6 buttons and arrow keys, which I like to have. The RGB is great with tons of modes. The thing i don't like is dust and other things getting inside, but that's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rayyan Haider

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical of this keyboard at the price point and I have never heard of the brand but I must say it is worth every penny. It looks great, feels great, and functions great! I have had big brands which cost more money and this keyboard is right on par with them at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Collins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first gaming keyboard. I didn't know what to expect. I love the RGB and the size of the keyboard. The keys are crazy loud which I wasn't expecting. All around very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: SUPER GOOD VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for $50! If it’s your first mechanical keyboard or if you’re on a budget I highly recommend this! Also if you dig deep enough on the internet you can find the software to customize each individual key color.
customer_reviews.author: Walter V

customer_reviews.title: Defective Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Overall, was a nice keyboard, switches were clickly like blues, and RGB was a nice feature, but as soon as I hooked it up and started typing with it, it bricked itself. The keyboard started spazzing out and typing numbers nonstop to the point where I couldnt open tabs because it would lag the text boxes with so many numbers. I tried re downloading the drivers but Redragons sites are so bad that they dont even carry drivers for this keyboard so it was pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Natividad

customer_reviews.title: Look at ll the pretty lights. Useless .
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about the keyboard, except the ugly red dragon logo and the fact that is useless for any activity requiring keyboard. The Keys/Buttons stick/chatter whatever you want to call it. Playing Apex legends, COD, I keep strafing after I let go of the key. Extremely irritating, but nothing a quick amazon return couldn't fix. Gave it a couple of week thinking the poor quality control would magically wear off .
customer_reviews.author: Cash

product_meta.title: Redragon K552 Mechanical Gaming Keyboard 60% Compact 87 Key Kumara Wired Cherry MX Blue Switches Equivalent for Windows PC Gamers (RGB Backlit Black)
feature_bullets: 87 Key Mechanical Gaming Keyboard with Custom Switches (Cherry Blue equivalent) for longevity with greater durability and responsiveness offering clicky medium resistance audible loud click sound crisp precise tactile feedback for typing and gaming

LED RGB Backlit Mechanical Gaming Keyboard 18 different RGB lighting modes, 9 different colors, 5 backlight brightness levels, breathing speed. Precision engineered keycaps offering crystal clear uniform backlighting

Anti Ghosting, ALL 87 keys are conflict free n-Key Rollover for ultimate Gaming performance. 12 Multimedia keys, Non-Slip Ergonomic, splash-proof Design with adjustable typing angle, High-Speed USB cable with gold-plated corrosion free USB connector

Compact TKL Tenkeyless Ergonomic Designed Computer Keyboard Durable Metal-ABS Construction with Plate-mounted mechanical keys and switches that stand up during marathon FPS gaming sessions like league of legends Fortnite PUGB Overwatch Call of Duty

PC Gaming Keyboard Compatibility Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, XP, Limited Mac OS keyboard support. Works well with all major Computers Brands and Gaming PCs MSI, Dell, Corsair, Alienware, Razer, Xbox One, Asus and others

specifications.Operating System: Limited Mac OS keyboard support., Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows 10
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,428 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
